title: key words from warwicks rework notes
body:
I'm looking at this and all i'm noticing

are

leap, leap, lunge, massively increased, bonuses, tripled, flee, fear, leaps in a direction,  distance increases, movement speed, **immune to crowd control **

end well this will not, he'll probably end up replacing hecarim or vi as one of the strongest single target lockdowns.

replies.body: doesnt look bad for a utility engage tank.
His lockdown is a skillshot, though, so tanks can step inbetween Warwick and the squishy to prevent him from diving.

Therefore making him much weaker than he used to be. Before I could run in range, ult onto the ADC, one shot them, and usually escape before the enemy team kills me. Now, I'll just be pacing around on the front line, unable to engage.

> [{quoted}](name=Axium,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gguE1vRP,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-01-11T04:03:49.758+0000)
>
> Therefore making him much weaker than he used to be. Before I could run in range, ult onto the ADC, one shot them, and usually escape before the enemy team kills me. Now, I'll just be pacing around on the front line, unable to engage.

Arguably. He's got crazy fast map-mobility with W, great combat sustain, and an AoE fear, so he's damn good.
No, then you flank them like a beast of prey with your outstanding speed and proceed to maul their backside until they're cut to ribbons.
If your team is too stupid to protect the carry I suppose he could be a problem.
what he needs now is %max hp dmg then he'll be a fully fledged Riot designed champion!
Or a true damage proc after 3 hits.
